content.event: Writing testable serverless apps using hexagonal architecture
content.description: According to many polls, testing serverless applications and fear of the cloud vendor lock-in are among the top five challenges organizations face when adopting serverless. We often hear that using serverless effectively requires a mind shift. But what does that mean?

content.event: An Intro to Serverless with AWS
content.description: Serverless is taking the world by storm and AWS is the #1 Cloud Provider in the market. In this workshop, you will learn how to put together all the major pieces in a Serverless application.

content.event: Moving to Microservices: Containers versus Serverless
content.description: Many companies are looking for a path to migrate from legacy monolithic applications, towards a more modern, cloud-based microservice architecture. But there are many choices along the way. How do you pick between two of the hottest trends in cloud architecture at the moment: containers and serverless?

La Arquitectura Serverless es un concepto que se está expandiendo con fuerza debido a sus ventajas de reducción de costos y mayor disponibilidad que ofrece en el diseño de aplicaciones, también genera nuevos desafíos en nuestras pruebas de control de calidad.

content.event: Straight to serverless - how NewDay bypassed containers & uses Azure serverless
content.description: Over the last 3 years, we have built a credit card platform covering all channels (mobile, web, chat and voice) serving both customers and internal users, entirely on Azure's Serverless architecture using technologies such as Azure Functions, App Services and CosmosDB. I'll talk about our technology choices and the reasons behind them and how we build, deploy, secure and operate our applications.

We are very excited to have another AWS Hero, Goran Opacic, as our next speaker. He will be speaking on: Supersonic Java Lambdas - how to run Java lambdas with cold start under 100 ms. Best practices for Java serverless devs in AWS world.
content.organizer: The Boston Amazon Web Services Meetup Group

content.event: Using DynamoDB in Serverless Applications By Alex DeBrie
content.description: For many reasons, DynamoDB has been the database of choice for serverless developers in the AWS ecosystem. In this talk, you'll learn why DynamoDB is such a great fit in serverless applications. Then, you'll learn how to get started with DynamoDB as well as some best practices for data modeling with DynamoDB.

content.event: How the Serverless Framework was my gateway drug into DevOps
content.description: The Serverless Framework is a easy entry point into learning, building, and maintaining AWS and (of course) serverless infrastructure. It makes AWS DevOps much simpler to get into by taking away some of the overwhelming-ness of AWS. It takes care of a lot of the infrastructure you need.

content.event: Setting up Azure Functions Using App Service Editor
content.description: With the continued ease of serverless computing, businesses need easier ways to prototype and build serverless functions. Learn how to set up Azure functions the easy way in this free event.

content.event: Serverless Series: Developing with Azure Functions
content.description: In this session, we take a deeper look at Azure Functions and how to develop, deploy, and maintain them. we will take a look at input and output bindings, work with configuration variables, and automate the deployment of our function.
Nicolas Jean - Migrating Monolithic Apps to Serverless

ServerlessDays Stockholm is a developer-oriented conference about serverless technologies. We believe in and encourage practical sessions, in which developers share their experience and lessons from real-world projects. This time with an all Nordics speaker line-up.

A 4-week introduction to running containers on AWS taught by AWS Container Hero Vlad Ionescu. Running Containers on AWS will teach you everything you need to know to start running containers using Docker, Fargate and Kubernetes.
11 January 2021 - 5 February 2021
£400, €450, $520

Start with an introduction into Lambda, introducing foundational concepts, moving onto API security, testing strategies, CI/CD, secret management, and finishing with operational best practices.
